Description: Fragment of floor and turn of rim of East Greek Wild Goat style pottery plate; greyish yellow slip; on floor, black band at edge of floor; lotus flower and bud frieze inside; exterior: part of two black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
According Mayence and Verhoogen, the sherd's provenance is unknown, while according to the register at the museum, the sherd was purchased in Cairo by M. Jean de Mot in 1909.
Bibliographic references: CVA Brussels III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Belgique (p. 3, pl. 3, no. 21)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1125)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Possibly purchased in Cairo by M. Jean de Mot
